AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure 4(b): statute governing the timing of appeals, allows for a 30-day additional period under certain conditions, includes materiality requirement and provisions for excusable neglect or good cause
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court issuing decisions subject to appeal within 30 days as required by Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure 4(b), has authority to extend time to file notice of appeal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States of America: party in the appeal, appellant regarding post-verdict suppression order, responsible for filing notice of appeal within specified deadlines, may be granted extension based on excusable neglect or good cause
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals: court hearing the appeal, bound by the law of the case doctrine, interprets Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure 4(b) in determining jurisdiction and timeliness of appeals
